name: Grape Oats Flaxseed Molasses Wheat Bread
description: Grape oats flaxseed molasses wheat bread. Healthy, delicious and packed full of goodness. This tasty wheat bread can be used for all sorts. Vegan Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 1.5 cups green or red seedless grapes

recipeInstructions.text: Warm 1/4 cup(60ml) water and add sugar and yeast to it . Mix well and keep aside for 10 minutes or until frothy.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm 1/4 cup(60ml) water and add sugar and yeast to it . Mix well and keep aside for 10 minutes or until frothy.

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender, add flax seed and oats and grind coarsely. Just a few quick short pulses.
recipeInstructions.name: In a blender, add flax seed and oats and grind coarsely. Just a few quick short pulses.

recipeInstructions.text: Add grapes and molasses and blend till grapes are blended. Use water if needed, though the grapes will be moist enough to make a puree.
recipeInstructions.name: Add grapes and molasses and blend till grapes are blended. Use water if needed, though the grapes will be moist enough to make a puree.

recipeInstructions.text: Grease the mixer bowl and add in the flours and salt. Mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Grease the mixer bowl and add in the flours and salt. Mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the oil , grape mixture, water and yeast mixture and vegan butter(optional, substitute another tablespoon of oil) and knead for 10-12 minutes( batches of 3-4 minutes and then scrape the bowl and wait for the mixer to cool a little if too warm)
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the oil , grape mixture, water and yeast mixture and vegan butter(optional, substitute another tablespoon of oil) and knead for 10-12 minutes( batches of 3-4 minutes and then scrape the bowl and wait for the mixer to cool a little if too warm)

recipeInstructions.text: Dough should be soft and pliable. Use more flour or water if needed. The molasses will give the dough a nice brown color and some additional stickiness.
recipeInstructions.name: Dough should be soft and pliable. Use more flour or water if needed. The molasses will give the dough a nice brown color and some additional stickiness.

recipeInstructions.text: Place dough in well oiled container, covered with plastic wrap in a warm place for 1.5 hours
recipeInstructions.name: Place dough in well oiled container, covered with plastic wrap in a warm place for 1.5 hours

recipeInstructions.text: Punch dough down and knead for a minute with additional flour if needed. Shape into loaf by pulling on all sides and tucking under. Use flour on hands to avoid dough sticking to hands.
recipeInstructions.name: Punch dough down and knead for a minute with additional flour if needed. Shape into loaf by pulling on all sides and tucking under. Use flour on hands to avoid dough sticking to hands.

recipeInstructions.text: Place loaf in well oiled bread pan and cover with a damp kitchen towel. Let rise for 45 minutes. Bake loaf at 375 degrees F for 40 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place loaf in well oiled bread pan and cover with a damp kitchen towel. Let rise for 45 minutes. Bake loaf at 375 degrees F for 40 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool completely before slicing. I usually place the cooled bread in the refrigerator for half an our before slicing with an electric knife for nice and clean slices!
recipeInstructions.name: Cool completely before slicing. I usually place the cooled bread in the refrigerator for half an our before slicing with an electric knife for nice and clean slices!

keywords: everyday bread recipe, healthy bread recipe, vegan bread recipe
